content.text: is designed to merge account billing adjustment records for accounts with the same account number and billing period revision. It processes records from a temporary table,
, and consolidates them into another table,

. The procedure ensures that only the latest records are retained and updates various fields based on the merged data. It also updates account sequence IDs and other related fields by joining with the
The complexity of this stored procedure is high due to the following reasons:
It involves multiple steps of data validation, insertion, and updates.
It uses complex SQL operations, including aggregation, conditional logic, and multiple joins.
It handles a significant amount of business logic related to billing adjustments and account management.
It involves intricate calculations and updates across several related tables.
This stored procedure does not take any input parameters. It operates on predefined tables within the database schema.
The procedure begins by truncating the
table to ensure it starts with a clean slate.
It inserts merged billing adjustment records into the
table. This involves aggregating data from the temporary table
The insertion includes complex calculations for fields like
, and others, depending on whether the billing is spanned or not.
table to ensure the latest account records are used.
Additional updates are made to the
table to set various fields like
The procedure includes conditional logic to handle different scenarios based on whether the billing is spanned and whether the billing period matches the revision.
is efficient for clearing data but should be used cautiously in a production environment due to its irreversible nature.
: The procedure involves multiple joins and aggregations, which can be resource-intensive, especially with large datasets.
: Proper indexing on the tables involved, especially on join and group-by columns, can significantly improve performance.
: If the dataset is large, consider processing in batches to avoid locking and performance degradation.
: The procedure assumes that the data in the temporary table is accurate and complete. Any discrepancies can lead to incorrect adjustments.
: The procedure does not handle concurrent executions, which could lead to race conditions or data inconsistencies.
: There is minimal error handling in the procedure. Adding error handling mechanisms would help in diagnosing issues during execution.
), which can limit flexibility and require updates if business rules change.
: As the volume of data grows, the performance of this procedure may degrade without optimization or hardware scaling.

-- =============================================
-- Create date: 06/09/2010 (DHO)
-- Update History:
-- Description:	Merge Account Billing Ajustment records with the same account number and same billing period revision
--				This procedure should be called after spanned records are processed and moved to adjustment gas table.
-- UPDATE	zd	2018-11-21	I added a filter to target only latest current account when stting the AccountSeqID
--							This modification will help process to choose the rigt accountSeqID
-- UPDATE   vy  2018-12-12  Modified for UniqueAccountSeqID
-- =============================================
CREATE PROCEDURE [CrisNationalGridWest].[usp_CRIS_MergeAccountBillingAdjustmentRecords]
AS
BEGIN
	/*
	Pseudo:
	if there are two transaction records with the same activity date time and transaction code
		return error 
	Insert merged BI record into temp table
	In adjustment record, overwrite latest record (biggest activity date) with information from merge data temp table; remove all other records.
	
    If there is BC record with no BI record forthe same period
		return error
	Insert merged BC record into temp table
	Update "Cancel" columns with data from temp table
	Remove BC records
	*/
	DECLARE @errMessage AS VARCHAR(500);
	/*********************************************************************
	 1. Merge BI records group by account number and billing perio revision
	***********************************************************************/
	/* 
		1.1 validate CrisNationalGridWest.UploadAccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas 
	*/
	TRUNCATE TABLE CrisNationalGridWest.UploadAccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas;

	INSERT INTO CrisNationalGridWest.UploadAccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas
		(IsProcessed,
		NumberOfTransactions, 
		BillingPeriod, 
		BillingPeriodRevision, 
		CancelLastRebillPeriod, 
		FirstBillingPeriodCanceled, 
		IsSpannedBilling, 
		NumberOfBillingPeriod, 
		UtilityCompanySeqid, 
		AccountSeqid, 
		AccountBillingSeqid, 
		AccountBillingCrisGasSeqid, 
		AccountInvoiceBillingGroup, 
		AccountNumber, 
		OriginalAccountNumber,
		MeterReadWorkDay, 
		AccountBillingStatus, 
		PreviousAccountBillingStatus, 
		AccountBillingStatusCodePeriod, 
		SpecialLedgerAccountNUmber, 
		GasRateCode, 
		BillFrequency, 
		EstimatedOrActualBillingCode, 
		PaidAdjustmentAmount, 
		TotalNetPaidAdjustmentCalc, 
		OriginalBilledAmount, 
		RevisedBilledAmount, 
		CancelBilledAmount,
		NetChangeDollars, 
		OriginalTherms, 
		RevisedTherms, 
		CancelTherms, 
		NetChangeTherms, 
		ThermFactor, 
		OriginalCCF, 
		RevisedCCF, 
		CancelCCF, 
		NetChangeCCF, 
		FromDate, 
		ToDate, 
		BillingDays, 
		NumberOfMeters, 
		CommodityChargeAmount, 
		DeliveryChargeAmount, 
		MTACommodityTax, 
		MTADeliveryTax, 
		SalesTax, 
		SystemBenefitsCharge, 
		RetailDecouplingMechanismCharge, 
		DeliveryRateSurcharge, 
		RealTimeNormalizationCharge, 
		LatePaymentCharge, 
		PaperBillCharge, 
		PriorPeriodAccountBalance, 
		AccountArrears, 
		TerminationBalance, 
		TotalPaymentsPosted, 
		CurrentAccountBalance, 
		DateLastPayment, 
		MiscellaneousChargeAmount, 
		MiscellaneousChargeType, 
		MiscellaneousCreditAmount, 
		MiscellaneousCreditType, 
		MiscellaneousCreditPaymentBillingPeriod, 
		SpannedGasChargeAmount, 
		SpannedBilledCCF, 
		SpannedBilledTherms, 
		SpannedBillingPeriodRevision, 
		SpannedFirstBillingPeriodCanceled, 
		SpannedFromDate, 
		SpannedToDate, 
		BillRenderDate, 
		PostMarkDate, 
		DatePaymentDue, 
		DateAcceptanceIntoOEC, 
		Notes,
		AuthenticatedUserID)
	SELECT 
		'N' as IsProcessed, 
		trans.NumberOfTransactions,
		trans.BillingPeriod,
		trans.BillingPeriodRevision,
		trans.BillingPeriod as CancelLastRebillPeriod, 
		trans.FirstBillingPeriodCanceled, 
		trans.IsSpannedBilling, 
		trans.NumberOfBillingPeriod, 
		trans.UtilityCompanySeqid, 
		NULL AS AccountSeqid, 
		NULL AS AccountBillingSeqid, 
		NULL AS AccountBillingCrisGasSeqid, 
		trans.AccountInvoiceBillingGroup, 
		trans.AccountNumber, 
		trans.AccountNumber as OriginalAccountNumber, 
		trans.MeterReadWorkDay, 
		'AC' as AccountBillingStatus, 
		'46' as PreviousAccountBillingStatus, 
		trans.BillingPeriod as AccountBillingStatusCodePeriod, 
		trans.SpecialLedgerAccountNumber, 
		trans.GasRateCode, 
		trans.BillFrequency, 
		trans.EstimatedOrActualBillingCode, 
		case 
			when trans.IsSpannedBilling ='Y' and trans.BillingPeriod = trans.BillingPeriodRevision then trans.CurrentAccountBalance - trans.SpannedGasChargeAmount
			when trans.IsSpannedBilling ='N' and trans.BillingPeriod = trans.BillingPeriodRevision then trans.CurrentAccountBalance - trans.GasChargeAmount 
			else 0
		end as PaidAdjustmentAmount, 
		case 
			when trans.IsSpannedBilling ='Y' and trans.BillingPeriod = trans.BillingPeriodRevision then trans.CurrentAccountBalance - trans.SpannedGasChargeAmount-trans.AccountArrears-trans.MiscellaneousChargeAmount
			when trans.IsSpannedBilling ='N' and trans.BillingPeriod = trans.BillingPeriodRevision then trans.CurrentAccountBalance - trans.GasChargeAmount-trans.AccountArrears-trans.MiscellaneousChargeAmount
			else 0
		end as TotalNetPaidAdjustmentCalc, 
		case 
			when trans.IsSpannedBilling ='Y' and trans.BillingPeriod = trans.BillingPeriodRevision then trans.SpannedGasChargeAmount
			when trans.IsSpannedBilling ='N' and trans.BillingPeriod = trans.BillingPeriodRevision then trans.GasChargeAmount 
			else 0
		end as OriginalBilledAmount, 
		trans.GasChargeAmount as RevisedBilledAmount, 
		0 as CancelBilledAmount,
		0 as NetChangeDollars, 
		case 
			when trans.IsSpannedBilling ='Y' and trans.BillingPeriod = trans.BillingPeriodRevision then trans.SpannedBilledTherms
			when trans.IsSpannedBilling ='N'  and trans.BillingPeriod = trans.BillingPeriodRevision then trans.BilledTherms  
			else 0
		end as OriginalTherms, 
		trans.BilledTherms as RevisedTherms, 
		0 as CancelTherms, 
		0 as NetChangeTherms, 
		trans.ThermFactor, 
		case 
			when trans.IsSpannedBilling ='Y' and trans.BillingPeriod = trans.BillingPeriodRevision then trans.SpannedBilledCCF
			when trans.IsSpannedBilling ='N'  and trans.BillingPeriod = trans.BillingPeriodRevision then trans.BilledCCF  
			else 0
		end as OriginalCCF, 
		trans.BilledCCF as RevisedCCF, 
		0 as CancelCCF, 
		0 as NetChangeCCF, 
		trans.FromDate, 
		trans.ToDate, 
		trans.BillingDays, 
		trans.NumberOfMeters, 
		trans.CommodityChargeAmount, 
		trans.DeliveryChargeAmount, 
		trans.MTACommodityTax, 
		trans.MTADeliveryTax, 
		trans.SalesTax, 
		trans.SystemBenefitsCharge, 
		trans.RetailDecouplingMechanismCharge, 
		trans.DeliveryRateSurcharge, 
		trans.RealTimeNormalizationCharge, 
		trans.LatePaymentCharge, 
		trans.PaperBillCharge, 
		0 as PriorPeriodAccountBalance, 
		trans.AccountArrears, 
		trans.TerminationBalance, 
		trans.TotalPaymentsPosted, 
		trans.CurrentAccountBalance, 
		trans.DateLastPayment, 
		trans.MiscellaneousChargeAmount, 
		trans.MiscellaneousChargeType, 
		NULL AS MiscellaneousCreditAmount, 
		NULL AS MiscellaneousCreditType, 
		NULL AS MiscellaneousCreditPaymentBillingPeriod, 
		trans.SpannedGasChargeAmount, 
		trans.SpannedBilledCCF, 
		trans.SpannedBilledTherms, 
		trans.SpannedBillingPeriodRevision, 
		trans.SpannedFirstBillingPeriodCanceled, 
		trans.SpannedFromDate, 
		trans.SpannedToDate, 
		trans.BillRenderDate, 
		trans.BillRenderDate as PostMarkDate, 
		dbo.CalculateRelativeDatePlusDays(trans.BillRenderDate,10) as DatePaymentDue, 
		trans.BillRenderDate as DateAcceptanceIntoOEC, 
		trans.Notes,
		1 as AuthenticatedUserID
		FROM (SELECT   
			MIN(UtilityCompanySeqid) AS UtilityCompanySeqid, MIN(AccountInvoiceBillingGroup) AS AccountInvoiceBillingGroup, AccountNumber, 
			MIN(MeterReadWorkDay) AS MeterReadWorkDay, BillingPeriodRevision, MIN(FirstBillingPeriodCanceled) AS FirstBillingPeriodCanceled, 
			MIN(NumberOfBillingPeriod) AS NumberOfBillingPeriod, MIN(FromDate) AS FromDate, MAX(ToDate) AS ToDate, MIN(BillingDays) AS BillingDays, 
			MIN(EstimatedOrActualBillingCode) AS EstimatedOrActualBillingCode, 
			SUM(CurrentAccountBalance) AS CurrentAccountBalance, 
			SUM(GasChargeAmount) AS GasChargeAmount, 
			SUM(AccountArrears) AS AccountArrears, 
			SUM(MiscellaneousChargeAmount) 
			AS MiscellaneousChargeAmount, 
			COUNT(*) AS NumberOfTransactions,
			SUM(BilledCCF) AS BilledCCF, 
			SUM(BilledTherms) AS BilledTherms, 
			SUM(CommodityChargeAmount) AS CommodityChargeAmount, 
			SUM(DeliveryChargeAmount) AS DeliveryChargeAmount, 
			SUM(MTACommodityTax) AS MTACommodityTax, 
			SUM(MTADeliveryTax) AS MTADeliveryTax, 
			SUM(SalesTax) AS SalesTax, 
			SUM(SystemBenefitsCharge) AS SystemBenefitsCharge, 
			SUM(RetailDecouplingMechanismCharge) 
			AS RetailDecouplingMechanismCharge, 
			SUM(DeliveryRateSurcharge) AS DeliveryRateSurcharge, 
			SUM(RealTimeNormalizationCharge) AS RealTimeNormalizationCharge,
			SUM(LatePaymentCharge) AS LatePaymentCharge, 
			SUM(PaperBillCharge) AS PaperBillCharge, 
			MAX(IsSpannedBilling) AS IsSpannedBilling, 
			MIN(UtilityServiceAccountName) AS UtilityServiceAccountName,
			MIN(UtilityServiceAddress) AS UtilityServiceAddress, 
			MIN(Borough) AS Borough, MIN(Zipcode) AS Zipcode, MIN(State) AS State, 
			MIN(SpecialLedgerAccountNUmber) AS SpecialLedgerAccountNumber, MIN(GasRateCode) AS GasRateCode, MIN(BillFrequency) AS BillFrequency, 
			MIN(ISNULL(PaidAdjustmentAmount, 0)) AS PaidAdjustmentAmount, 
			MIN(ISNULL(TotalNetPaidAdjustmentCalc, 0)) AS TotalNetPaidAdjustmentCalc, 
			MIN(TerminationBalance) AS TerminationBalance, 
			MAX(TotalPaymentsPosted) AS TotalPaymentsPosted, 
			MAX(DateLastPayment) AS DateLastPayment, 
			MIN(DISTINCT MiscellaneousChargeType) AS MiscellaneousChargeType, 
			MIN(DISTINCT SpannedGasChargeAmount) AS SpannedGasChargeAmount, 
			MIN(DISTINCT SpannedBilledCCF) AS SpannedBilledCCF, 
			MIN(DISTINCT SpannedBilledTherms) AS SpannedBilledTherms, 
			MIN(DISTINCT SpannedBillingPeriodRevision) AS SpannedBillingPeriodRevision, 
			MAX(DISTINCT SpannedFirstBillingPeriodCanceled) AS SpannedFirstBillingPeriodCanceled, 
			MIN(DISTINCT SpannedFromDate) AS SpannedFromDate, 
			MAX(DISTINCT SpannedToDate) AS SpannedToDate, 
			MIN(DISTINCT Notes) AS Notes,
			MAX(ThermFactor) AS ThermFactor,
			MIN(BillRenderDate) AS BillRenderDate,
			MIN(NumberOfMeters) AS NumberOfMeters,
			MIN(BillingPeriod) AS BillingPeriod
			FROM CrisNationalGridWest.UploadAccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGasTemp
			GROUP BY BillingPeriodRevision, AccountNumber
		) as trans order by trans.BillingPeriodRevision desc,trans.AccountNumber

	--where condition is added to target latest current accounts
	UPDATE CrisNationalGridWest.UploadAccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas
	SET AccountSeqid =Billing.Account.AccountSeqid,
	UniqueAccountSeqid = Billing.Account.UniqueAccountSeqid /* added 12/12/2018 */
	FROM CrisNationalGridWest.UploadAccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas
		INNER JOIN Billing.Account ON CrisNationalGridWest.UploadAccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.AccountNumber = Billing.Account.OriginalAccountNumber
	WHERE Account.AccountSeqid IN 
	(SELECT MAX(aa.AccountSeqid) AccountSeqid
	FROM Billing.Account AS aa 
	WHERE aa.IsCurrentRecord = 'Y'
	GROUP BY aa.CurrentAccountNumber)

	UPDATE CrisNationalGridWest.UploadAccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas
	SET             
		OriginalAccountNumber = ab.OriginalAccountNumber,
		AccountSeqid =ab.AccountSeqid, 
		UniqueAccountSeqid = ab.UniqueAccountSeqid, /* added 12/12/2018 */
		AccountBillingSeqid =ab.AccountBillingSeqid,
		AccountBillingCrisGasSeqid =abcg.AccountBillingCrisGasSeqid, 
		NetChangeDollars = CrisNationalGridWest.UploadAccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.RevisedBilledAmount - ab.RevisedBilledAmount,
		CancelBilledAmount= -1 * ab.RevisedBilledAmount,
		CancelTherms =-1 * ab.AccountEnergyUsage,
		NetChangeTherms =RevisedTherms - ab.AccountEnergyUsage, 
		OriginalBilledAmount =ab.OriginalBilledAmount, 
		CancelCCF =-1 * abcg.BilledCCF,
		NetChangeCCF =RevisedCCF - abcg.BilledCCF, 
		PriorPeriodAccountBalance = isnull(ab.TotalAmountDue,0),
		AccountBillingStatus=Billing.Account.AccountStatus, 
		PreviousAccountBillingStatus = Billing.Account.AccountPreviousStatus,
		AccountBillingStatusCodePeriod = CrisNationalGridWest.UploadAccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.BillingPeriod,
		Notes = 'Adjustment   - '+ CrisNationalGridWest.UploadAccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.Notes
	FROM 
		Billing.AccountBilling as ab INNER JOIN
		Billing.Account /* ON ab.AccountSeqid = Billing.Account.AccountSeqid AND 
		ab.AccountSeqid = Billing.Account.AccountSeqid Comment out on 12/12/2018 */
		on ab.UniqueAccountSeqId = Billing.Account.UniqueAccountSeqid and Billing.Account.IsCurrentRecord = 'Y' INNER JOIN /* added 12/12/2018 */
		CrisNationalGridWest.UploadAccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas ON 
		ab.BillingPeriodRevision = CrisNationalGridWest.UploadAccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.BillingPeriodRevision AND 
		Billing.Account.OriginalAccountNumber = CrisNationalGridWest.UploadAccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.AccountNumber INNER JOIN
		Billing.AccountBillingCrisGas as abcg ON ab.BillingPeriodRevision = abcg.BillingPeriodRevision AND 
		ab.AccountBillingSeqid = abcg.AccountBillingSeqid
	WHERE 
		ab.CurrentInvoiceAccountBillingGroup = 3 AND 
		ab.UtilityCompanySeqid = 2 AND 
		(CrisNationalGridWest.UploadAccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.BillingPeriodRevision <> CrisNationalGridWest.UploadAccountBillingAdjustmentCrisGas.BillingPeriod);
END;
